recipes.name: Grilled Salmon
steps: Preheat grill to medium heat.
Brush salmon fillets with olive oil.
Season with salt, pepper, and garlic.
Grill salmon for 6-8 minutes on each side until opaque.
Serve with a squeeze of fresh lemon.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
steps: Boil pasta in salted water according to package instructions.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated parmesan cheese.
Cook guanciale in a skillet until crispy.
Drain pasta and reserve some pasta water.
Toss pasta with guanciale, egg mixture, and some reserved pasta water.
Season with black pepper and serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Curry
steps: Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger in a large pot.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Stir in curry powder and tomatoes, cooking until soft.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 20 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Paneer Tikka
steps: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, and lemon juice.
Marinate paneer cubes in the mixture for 1 hour.
Thread paneer onto skewers.
Grill or bake at high heat until charred.
Serve with chutney and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken with ginger garlic paste, lemon juice, salt, and red chili powder. Set aside for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a pan, add marinated chicken, and cook until browned.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates.
Add cream, garam masala, and kasuri methi, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch spinach in boiling water and puree it.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and ginger garlic paste, and sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped onions and cook until golden.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, and garam masala, and cook until oil separates.
Stir in spinach puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in cream before serving.

recipes.name: Chole Bhature
steps: Pressure cook soaked chickpeas until soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and ginger garlic paste, and sauté until golden.
Add chopped onions and cook until brown.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, chole masala, and garam masala, and cook until oil separates.
Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 10 minutes.
For bhature, mix flour, yogurt, and salt into a dough. Roll and deep fry until golden.
Serve chole with hot bhature.

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
steps: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden.
Mash boiled potatoes, add turmeric and salt, and cook for 5 minutes.
Spread dosa batter on a hot tawa to make thin crepes.
Place potato filling in the center of the dosa and fold.
Serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: Aloo Paratha
steps: Knead wheat flour with water into a dough and let it rest for 15 minutes.
Mash boiled potatoes and mix with chopped onions, green chilies, cumin seeds, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Divide the dough into balls, roll out each ball, and stuff with potato filling.
Seal and roll out the stuffed dough into parathas.
Cook on a hot tawa with butter or ghee until golden brown.
Serve hot with curd or pickle.

recipes.name: Chicken Biryani
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Set aside for 1 hour.
Cook basmati rice with bay leaves, cloves, and cardamoms until 70% done.
Fry sliced onions until crispy and golden brown.
Layer marinated chicken, rice, and fried onions in a large pot.
Dissolve saffron in warm milk and pour over the rice.
Cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes until chicken is tender and rice is fully cooked.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with raita.
